results.description: Use est_eps vs eps_previous_estimate_value to capture upward surprises in EPS estimates. Applied SUGGESTION1 (two fields). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector field). Both fields have high coverage so ts_backfill not needed (SUGGESTION3 not applied). Chose fields with strong user/alpha counts (SUGGESTION4 applied). Kept implementation short and within operator/datafield limits (KEEP_IN_MINDs). Confidence: 0.78 because est_eps and eps_previous_estimate_value are widely used and historically predictive.

Normalize number of upper revisions by forecast count to find stocks with concentrated upgrades. Applied SUGGESTION1. No vector field (SUGGESTION2 N/A). Both fields coverage >0.6 so no ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3 not applied). Prioritized high user/alphaCount fields (SUGGESTION4). Kept operators small per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence: 0.72 due to robust signal from revision concentration.

High stddev of sales estimates vs low count suggests fragile consensus — potential re-rating. Used sales_estimate_standard_deviation and sales_estimate_count per SUGGESTION1. No vector wrapping (SUGGESTION2). Coverage high so no ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Both fields have reasonable user counts (SUGGESTION4). Implementation short and simple to meet KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.65 because dispersion often signals uncertainty but is noisier.

Confidence: 0.75 due to stable predictive power of sales revisions.

Picked widely-used fields (SUGGESTION4). Short implementation per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence: 0.70 given EBITDA's informative nature and slightly lower coverage on mean.
